com.dhbikoff.breakout

Class GameView

  • java.lang.Object
    • SurfaceView
      • com.dhbikoff.breakout.GameView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class GameView
extends SurfaceView
implements Runnable
    Creates and draws the graphics for the game. Runs a Thread for animation and game physics. Saves and restores game data when paused or restored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameView

        public GameView(Context context,
        int launchNewGame,
        boolean sound)
        Constructor. Sets sound state and new game signal depending on the incoming intent from the Breakout class. Instantiates the ball, blocks, and paddle. Sets up the Paint parameters for drawing text to the screen.
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context
        launchNewGame - start new game or load save game
        sound - sound on/off

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the game thread. Sets the frame rate for drawing graphics. Acquires a canvas for drawing. If no blocks exist, initialize game objects. Moves the paddle according to touch events. Checks for collisions as the ball's moves. Keeps track of player turns and ends the game when turns run out. Awards the player an extra turn when a level is completed. Draws text to the screen showing player score and turns remaining. Draws text to announce when the game begins or ends.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • drawToCanvas

        private void drawToCanvas(Canvas canvas)
        Draws graphics to the screen.
        Parameters:
        canvas - graphics canvas

      • engine

        private void engine(Canvas canvas,
          int waitCt)
        Pauses the animation until the wait counter is satisfied. Sets the velocity and coordinates of the ball. Checks for collisions. Checks if the game is over. Draws text to alert the user if the ball restarts or the game is over.
        Parameters:
        canvas - graphics canvas
        waitCt - number of frames to pause the game

      • gameOver

        private void gameOver(Canvas canvas)
        Resets variables to signal a new game. Deletes the remaining blocks list. When the run function sees the blocks list is empty, it will initialize a new game board.
        Parameters:
        canvas - graphics canvas

      • initObjects

        private void initObjects(Canvas canvas)
        Initializes graphical objects. Restores game state if an existing game is continued.
        Parameters:
        canvas - graphical canvas

      • restoreBlocks

        private void restoreBlocks(ArrayList<int[]> arr)
        Restores a saved ArrayList of blocks. Reads through an ArrayList of integer Arrays. Passes the values to construct a block and adds the block to an ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        arr - ArrayList of integer arrays containing the coordinates and color of the saved blocks.

      • restoreGameData

        private void restoreGameData()
        Opens a saved game file and reads in data to restore saved game state.

      • initBlocks

        private void initBlocks(Canvas canvas)
        Initializes blocks. Measures the width and height of the canvas for the dimensions and coordinates of the blocks. Sets the color depending on the block's row. Adds the block to an ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        canvas - graphics canvas

      • drawBlocks

        private void drawBlocks(Canvas canvas)
        Draws blocks to screen
        Parameters:
        canvas - graphical canvas

      • saveGameData

        private void saveGameData()
        Saves game state. Reads block color and coordinates into an ArrayList. Saves blocks, player points, and player turns into a data file.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Saves game data and destroys Thread.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the game. Starts a new game Thread.

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent(MotionEvent event)
        Overridden Touch event listener. Reads screen touches to move the paddle.
        Parameters:
        event - screen touch event
        Returns:
        true
